adjective.description: More or less cubic in shape.
examples: the school was a hideous cuboid erection of brick and glass

noun.description: A solid which has six rectangular faces at right angles to each other.
A squat tarsal bone on the outer side of the foot, articulating with the heel bone and the fourth and fifth metatarsals.

origin: Early 19th century: from modern Latin cuboides, from Greek kuboeidēs, from kubos (see cube).
